titleStmt.title: TEI description of people mentioned and depicted in the Historic Images, New Technologies (HINT) Project

availability.p: Copyright 2013, The Historical Society of Pennsylvania. HSP makes a claim of copyright only to original contributions made by the Historic Images, New Technologies (HINT) Project participants and other staff. Permission is granted to download, transmit or otherwise reproduce, distribute or display the text contributions to this work claimed by HSP for non-profit educational purposes, provided that this header is included in its entirety. For inquiries about commercial uses, please contact the Historical Society of Pennsylvania. HSP retains the rights of all images unless otherwise noted. Possession of an HSP digital image does not constitute permission to use or publish it. Requests for digital imaging, other reproduction services, and the intended use of reproductions must be made in writing to the Rights and Reproductions Coordinator at rnr@hsp.org.

projectDesc.p: The Historic Images, New Technologies (HINT) project aims to enhance description and discovery of the Historical Society of Pennsylvania's graphics materials and promote the linking and sharing of content among institutions and scholars. The project will result in an update to HSP's digital image viewer and an online digital history exhibit, featuring 500 encoded political cartoons, that will demonstrate the new viewer's capabilities and provide interpretive and contextual materials to encourage users to interact with historical images in new ways. This project was funded by a grant from the National Historical Publications and Records Commission's (NHPRC) Innovation in Archives and Documentary Editing program.

President of the Confederate States of America, 1861-1865

note.p:
Jefferson Davis is apparently mostly known for wearing a dress that one time
For example, see the cartoon, The Stern Statesman.. He may have also been involved in the Civil War and some kind of official for the Confederate States of America.

person.bibl: Cooper, William J. Jr. Jefferson Davis, American. New York: Vintage Books, 2000.

note.p: Abraham Lincoln had the best beard the world has ever known. He married Mary Todd Lincoln in 1842.
